name: Conflict
description: The tension between opposing forces seeking resolution. Like storm clouds gathering before rain, this represents necessary conflict that leads to clarity.
image: Heaven and water moving in opposite directions

lines_in_transition.6: Resolution Phase - Return to harmony; Accept outcome with grace
lines_in_transition.5: Righteous Position - Standing firm in truth; Maintain ethical ground
lines_in_transition.4: Strategic Retreat - Knowing when not to engage; Choose battles wisely
lines_in_transition.3: Past Patterns - Learning from old conflicts; Avoid repeating cycles
lines_in_transition.2: Inner Strength - Building personal resources; Prepare for challenge
lines_in_transition.1: Early Signs - Recognizing brewing conflict; Address issues early

tholonic_analysis.negotiation: The hexagram represents the negotiation between creative force (Qian/Heaven) and flow (Kan/Water). This creates dynamic tension between opposing movements.
tholonic_analysis.limitation: Structure is provided by heaven above, indicating that conflict must serve higher purpose. The water below suggests that engagement must remain fluid.
tholonic_analysis.contribution: This pattern contributes to evolution by showing how opposition can lead to growth. It demonstrates how conflict can clarify truth through contrast.
tholonic_analysis.significance_in_thologram: In the tholonic system, this hexagram represents where consciousness encounters resistance. It shows how awareness navigates opposition productively.

no_moving_lines: When no lines are changing, focus on maintaining ethical position. Success comes through principled engagement rather than aggressive confrontation.
all_moving_lines: A complete transformation in how conflict is handled is indicated. Old patterns of engagement must give way to new approaches. Ensure integrity remains while embracing change.
